result.execSummary:
The defendant Marques Blackwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, by 12/21/15.  Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
*Fine is set at ZERO.
*Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Consecutive to:  To any other sentence; release for work; with credit for 4 (four) days time served. Court ordered report date be 10/29/15 by 5:00 pm.
*For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED defense request for expungement.
*Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marques Blackwell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Marques Blackwell in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; release for work; with credit for 4 (four) days time served. Court ordered report date be 10/29/15 by 5:00 pm.

Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, by 12/21/15.  Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
Fine is set at ZERO.
Drivers license suspension is imposed for 6 MONTHS.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.

For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED defense request for expungement.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Filed;
Sentencing Referral Form;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Sentencing letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services pretrial report dated October 21, 2015 received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 666
cf

Defendant Marques Blackwell in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
 AS TO COUNT 1 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, the victim  and the defendant.   Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 10-22-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with 807 W Atkinson Ave. and BP Gas Station

Defendant Marques Blackwell in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Marques Blackwell in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
